title: What's Skaarl's gender?
body: Kled calls the lizard both he and she :/

replies.body: I wouldn't be surprised if Kled doesnt know.
Correct!  (  Much like some people Ive met who own pet smakes.)
Question: is it the same Skaarl this whole time?  Considering how old Kled is?

Depends on how long lived Skaarl's species is. Potentially Kled never noticed himself outlive Skaarl, and assumed that, after finding a new lizard, Skaarl had gotten so scared it'd forgotten its training, so he just trained a new lizard thinking it was the same Skaarl.

I honestly have a stupid theory that Skaarl has a stupidly short lifespan and every time it runs off it does so to give birth. 

Kinda like a mayfly.
Now that you mention it, any upcoming smake champion? Cassiopeia is more like a mermaismake, anything like the Basilisk from the Harry Potter? :P

>smake

This is my new nickname for my snake.
I'll know her as a female just because Kled says "girl" quite a bit as opposed to he/she, but word of God, Kled has absolutely no idea and it's whatever you want it to be. :P

>Kled calls the lizard both he and she :/

Much to learn, you (all) still have.
_Seriously, haven't you seen Jurassic Park? Earliest reference that I know of to gender-changing animals. Google took care of the rest._ :/

There exist lizards which change gender depending on the climate.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/hot-temperatures-are-changing-the-gender-of-lizards-study-finds-10359893.html

So I would guess Kled refers to a he or she depending on when Skaarl actually is a he or she.
Who cares? Just play him and have fun lmao
